Package ca.queensu.cs.cisc124.notes.turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.queensu.cs.cisc124.notes.turtle.Turtle
  • public class Turtle
extends Object
    A class that supports turtle graphics.

    A turtle walks in a straight line forwards or backwards in the direction that it is currently pointing towards.

    The direction that the turtle is pointing towards is called the heading of the turtle. The heading is an angle measured from the positive x-axis to the vector starting from the turtle's current position and pointing in the direction that the turtle is facing in. The turtle maintains its heading as a value between 0 (inclusive) and 360 (exclusive) degrees.

    A turtle can change its heading without moving by turning left (counter clockwise) or right (clockwise) in place.

    A turtle holds a pen using its tail and the pen can be up or down If the pen is down then a line is drawn when the turtle walks forwards or backwards. If the pen is up then no line is drawn when the turtle walks.

    Besides walking forwards or backwards, a turtle can teleport to a specified point. No line is drawn when a turtle changes its position by teleporting.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Turtle()
      Create a turtle at location (0, 0) with a heading of 0.0 degrees.
      Turtle​(Point2 position, double heading, Pen pen)
      Create a turtle with the given starting position, heading, and pen color.
      Turtle​(Turtle other)
      Create a turtle from another turtle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle()
        Create a turtle at location (0, 0) with a heading of 0.0 degrees. The turtle's pen is Color.BLACK, with a radius of 0.5f, and is in the down state.

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(Turtle other)
        Create a turtle from another turtle. The created turtle is initialized having the same position, heading, and pen as the other turtle, but moves independently of the other turtle.
        Parameters:
        other - the turtle to copy

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(Point2 position,
              double heading,
              Pen pen)
        Create a turtle with the given starting position, heading, and pen color. The pen radius is set to 0.5f and is in the down state.
        Parameters:
        position - the starting position of the turtle
        heading - the angle in degrees from the x axis that the turtle is facing in
        pen - a pen to draw with
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the heading is negative or greater than 360 degrees
        NullPointerException - if the pen is null

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        public Point2 getPosition()
        Gets a copy of the current position of the turtle.

        The returned point is a new Point2 instance equal to the turtle's current position.

        Returns:
        the current position of the turtle

      • getHeading

        public double getHeading()
        Gets the direction that the turtle is facing in as an angle measured from the x axis. The angle of the turtle is always in the range of 0 degrees, inclusive, and +360 degrees, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the angle measured in degrees from the x axis that the turtle is facing

      • teleport

        public void teleport​(Point2 position)
        Teleports the turtle to the specified position without drawing a line.

        The turtle changes the coordinates of its position to equal to coordinates of the specified position.

        Parameters:
        position - the position to teleport the turtle to

      • forward

        public void forward​(double distance)
        Walks the turtle forward by a given distance in the heading direction changing the position of the turtle.

        A line is drawn between the current position of the turtle and the new position of the turtle if the pen is currently on.

        The heading of the turtle does not change.

        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to move
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if distance is less than zero

      • backward

        public void backward​(double distance)
        Walks the turtle backward by a given distance in the direction opposite to the heading direction changing the position of the turtle.

        A line is drawn between the current position of the turtle and the new position of the turtle if the pen is currently on.

        The heading of the turtle does not change.

        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to move
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if distance is less than zero

      • turnLeft

        public void turnLeft​(double delta)
        Turns the turtle to the left (counter clockwise), increasing its heading by delta degrees. The heading of the turtle is always corrected to lie within the range of 0 degrees, inclusive, and +360 degrees, exclusive.
        Parameters:
        delta - the angle in degrees to turn counter clockwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if distance is less than zero

      • turnRight

        public void turnRight​(double delta)
        Turns the turtle to the right (clockwise), decreasing its heading by delta degrees. The heading of the turtle is always corrected to lie within the range of 0 degrees, inclusive, and +360 degrees, exclusive.
        Parameters:
        delta - the angle in degrees to turn clockwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if distance is less than zero

      • isPenDown

        public boolean isPenDown()
        Returns true if the turtle's pen is down, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the turtle's pen is down, false otherwise

      • penDown

        public void penDown()
        Sets the pen to the down position. A line will be drawn when the turtle moves forward or backwards.

      • penUp

        public void penUp()
        Sets the pen to the up position. No line will be drawn when the turtle moves forward or backwards.

      • pen

        public Pen pen()
        Returns a reference to the pen held by the turtle.
        Returns:
        the pen held by the turtle

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this turtle. The string representation is:
        1. the position of the turtle (as given by Point2.toString), followed by
        2. a comma and a space, followed by
        3. the heading, followed by
        4. a space, the string "degrees", a space, and a comma, followed by
        5. the pen color (as given by Color.toString)
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this turtle
